attributes.action: Increase free and confidential mental health support for students aged 13-25
attributes.background: Recently there have been drastic cuts to mental health services, even though many school students are affected by mental illness; this need has been further heightened by an increase of suicide in universities.

attributes.action: To guarantee the rights of EU nationals in the UK and UK nationals in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, the futures of EU nationals living in the UK and UK nationals living in EU countries are completely unknown. We demand that they are allowed to remain in the country of their choice.
attributes.additional_details: This petition does not seek to overturn the recent referendum result or request a second referendum.  It simply seeks to ensure that any Brexit deal guarantees the residency and employment rights of EU nationals living in Britain and Britons living in other EU countries which are not currently guaranteed. This has left many individuals and their families uncertain of their futures.

attributes.action: Ban the production and selling of mink lashes!
attributes.background: Mink eyelashes are a growing trend,but these animals are put through a huge amount of pain just for there fur. The animals are kept in confind cages and factory's. None of this is humane. All for humans to look "nice" while these animals have no say if people can use there fur,and through pain.
attributes.additional_details: No use of animal fur is humane.

attributes.action: We are calling on the Govt to strip Thameslink Govia of their rail franchise.
attributes.background: Govia Thameslink has the highest number of passenger journeys but the lowest customer satisfaction rates and the lowest PPM of any UK rail network. There has been a continuous decline in their PPM measure since 2015. They have the second highest rate of cancellation & significantly late running.
attributes.additional_details:
Thameslink Govia's poor management is evident in:
The lack of adequate contingency plans to cope with disruption.
Poor & inaccurate information provided to customers 
The ongoing staffing disputes without major disruption to the network. 
Continually increasing fares with declining service levels

We urge the government to urgently review the situation and award the franchise to a company which can deliver a consistent, good level of service.

attributes.action: Provide a clear and open way to reply to government responses to petitions
attributes.background: The petitions website was set up as a way for the electorate to influence policy and hold the government to account. While this is an excellent tool for improving communication between the public and the government, the responses are frequently dismissive with no recourse for the public to reply.
attributes.additional_details:
When responses are dismissive or ignore the core concerns of the people, it increases disillusionment and leads to disenfranchisement. In order to improve the power of this democratic tool to hold the government to account, there needs to be a clear, open and visible way for the public to reply to the government responses. 

Please provide a way for the public to reply and engage with government responses to improve the power of this tool.

attributes.action: Increase payment for Early Years Education Funding
attributes.background: As a self funded Pre School and with the rising wage costs along with upcoming work pensions we along with many other pre schools are finding sustainably impossible. Funding that we rely on has not increased to cover these costs. We fear closure leading to no places for children in the future.
attributes.additional_details: We have to have a certain amount of staff per group of children who all need to be paid at least the minimum wage. We are self funded. Incoming money funds staff costs, rent, phone, equipment & resources, HMRC, Ofsted, insurances, food etc. Cash flow forecasts shows we will not be able to sustain provision in the near future if funding is not increased, leaving children without a place and parents without childcare & staff without an income.

attributes.action: Cancel the Validity of the EU referendum as the government held it illegally.
attributes.background: No votes for European residents but votes for Commonwealth residents. None for long standing Brits living elsewhere in the EU. The result is too marginal to call decisive. The 2 million EU citizens working and living  in the UK directly affected by this should be given a vote at a new referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Referendums are one off events, so the rules about who can vote are different each time. www.electoralcommission.org.uk

Millions of EU UK Citizens have helped this country be the success it has been. A set of voting eligibility rules should have been laid out for EU citizens who have been here a certain amount of time, made the UK their home and contributed.

attributes.action: Motorcycle filtering signs.
attributes.background: to lower the risk of deaths and near misses on the UK motorways, filtering signs to be placed on the gang ways above motorways or on the side of roads informing other motorists to look out for bikes. Also stipulate the legal filtering speed limits in the highway code.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the amount of motorcycle deaths and/or near misses on the UK roads down to filtering, as a road safety intensive nation wide I feel the government should introduce a filtering sign along UK roads, to remind other road users of filtering bikes and the legalities (stated in section 88 of the highway code) to be move vigilant for filtering motorcycles.

attributes.action: Abolish the 1 hour clock changes in March and October and introduce double BST
attributes.background:
The clocks going back in October is shown to increase road accidents, crime, and mental health conditions such as SAD due to the darker nights. 
Double BST would put us at GMT+1 in winter, and GMT+2 in summer, bringing us into line with Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the RoSPA, more people are killed and injured in road accidents due to the darker Autumn and winter evenings. 
Cambridge university estimates 450,000 tonnes of carbon emissions saved per year. 
It would align the UK with European times, aiding businesses. 
It would boost tourism that is dependent on daylight hours by up to two months a year. 
It would shift the average year long sunset time from 18:35 to 19:30, giving an average of 55minutes per day of extra light in the evenings.

attributes.action: Waive the Police charges for the return of stolen vehicles to victims
attributes.background: Like many people I was recently the victim of motorcycle theft,  the police recently found the vehicle and told me it was subject to a £40 a day holding charge.  This is nothing but shameful profiteering on a victims loss from the Metroploitan Police a their policy should be changed.

attributes.action: Regulate car insurance companies over cost of car insurance
attributes.background: We the everyday motorists pay excessive amounts for car insurance, thre needs to be a look into their practice's and costing and needs to be capped or regulated
attributes.additional_details:
Car insurance for a 33yr old driver with no points , no accidents and 0 no claims on a 1.4 - £700 

Car insurance for same driver with 2 non fault accidents, 9 points for speeding when no accident involved and 1 years no claims on a 1.2 - £3500 

How can a insurance company expect to charge 5x for a smaller car when there has never been a cost to them .

attributes.action: Increase funding for investigating tool theft for tradesmen.
attributes.background:
Yet to find a tradesman who hasn't had their tools stolen at some point in their life. It seems like there is very little investigation into tool theft and cases are quickly closed.

Took theft is extremely expensive for the victim and damages our careers and livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details: I want to see the police pay more attention to tool theft and harsher penalties for those caught handling stolen tools.

attributes.action: Make welfare services VAT exempt
attributes.background: Why should families using organisations to help them with Dementia care, loneliness, respite etc pay VAT? Help us deal with the red tape that makes VAT applicable to a much needed elderly care service by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details: If an organisation is not a Charity, or it is 'out of scope' for CQC regulation, VAT is required to be paid by end users. Support in the home does have to involve personal care. Currently, families choosing services from a LTD or LLP company to help themselves or a loved one rather than state or charity provision are penalised with 20% VAT on vital care services.  Volunteer services and Charities can't cope with demand, so if you are willing to  pay for services that are not "personal care", we do not think VAT should have to be added. Seniors Helping Seniors® is an organisation that has evidence of great care outcomes for families and we are fighting the VAT charges. Refund will be passed back to every single family who has had to pay VAT to date.

attributes.action: Accept Functional Skills as an equivalent qualification for EYE's Level 3
attributes.background: I am very concerned about the negative impact of the Government’s decision that all Level 3 Early Years Educators must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths with no equitable alternative such as Functional Skills allowed.
attributes.additional_details: Your policy will mean there will be a significant shortfall in the number of Level 3 childcare practitioners, which threatens the quality of care that children will get in early years settings.

attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry to the conduct of both sides of the EU referendum campaign
attributes.background: The way in which the recent campaigns were conducted was a disgrace with the public appearing to be either mislead or lied too. The facts and statements made by all sides should be considered and the enquiry should have the power to sanction those found to be either lying or misleading the public.

attributes.action: Form a Home or National Defence Force of HM Forces Veterans.
attributes.background: There are thousands of able and willing HM Forces Veterans who would step forward if required to form a Home or National Defence Force to assist in Border Protection or assistance to Police and regular Forces in times of emergency, or civil unrest.
attributes.additional_details: These Veterans are a valuable asset to this Nation, well trained, experienced and able to fulfill tasks and roles during times of emergency or civil unrest.

attributes.action: Stop passport checks on pregnant NHS patients
attributes.background: The proposals by St. George's University Hospital Trust, and backed by the Home Office, that pregnant people would be subject to mandatory passport checks before being able to access care to crack down on "health tourism" are deeply worrying, steeped in racism, and should be rejected immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal wards already require a form with proof of eligibility but these cannot always be done fully. The proposals would require checks to be stricter and could, in the view of multiple critics and medical staff, lead to higher risk to patient health. These proposals give no assurance that patients would have access to care regardless of immigration status, as is current government policy and law. Focus on "health tourism" is a racist smokescreen for the Conservatives' destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: Repeal part of the Legal Services Act 2007 to abolish the SRA and LSB
attributes.background: The Legal Services Act 2007 imposed a highly complex structure for regulation of solicitors.  It is expensive to run and gave the public no greater protections.  If regulation can revert to The Law Society (supervised by the Ministry of Justice), the money saved can be used to finance legal aid.

attributes.action: Allow the british army to grow beards like the navy
attributes.background: It should be allowed for the british army to grow beards, the navy are allowed so why isnt the army? If you are in the british army and you are a sikh then you can grow a beard, this goes against equalitiy and diversity.
attributes.additional_details: The navy has regulations and guidelines for what classes as a beard, why can the army not have the same?

attributes.action: Debate the two letters from Professor A.C. Grayling and Phillip Kolvin QC.
attributes.background: I want action because I believe the arguments in these two letters are irrefutable.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.nchlondon.ac.uk/2016/07/01/professor-c-graylings-letter-650-mps-urging-parliament-not-support-motion-trigger-article-50-lisbon-treaty-1-july-2016/

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules that are blocking the hiring of Specialist Chefs
attributes.background: UK's Asian cuisine industry is lacking skill ready Professional Chefs. Though Chefs are on government's Shortage Occupation list it disqualifies restaurants that allow collection or delivery of restaurant meals as NOT having specialist skill needs in spite of this involving the same skill input
attributes.additional_details:
The industry is in urgent need of experienced skill ready Chefs from outside EU on temporary basis to support business operations, and to enable training and development of home grown Chefs. However this is being prevented by inappropriate rules. This petition calls for following amendments to the Shortage Occupation rules 

1. Remove the 'take away' clause

2. Raise skill recognition to NQF level 6  

3. Amend minimum salary to £25,000 

4. Allow temporary non settlement based UK entry

attributes.action: Ban all religious practises from public outdoor areas.
attributes.background: Increasing trend of spreading religious practices, wordpship, prayers to parks, streets and in other public places directly discriminate non believing population and prevent peaceful coexistence of all religions with non believing population in the UK.

attributes.action: Social Services should have to voice record all meetings and visits.
attributes.background: Social services often try to put those who attend meetings with them off when it come to recording meetings. Their code of conduct explains they should be open and honest so I question why they will not do this. It would help to avoid disputes over what was said and ensure clarity for documentation
attributes.additional_details:
Social services documents are well known for being inaccurate and falsified. If you notify social services you wish to record all meetings they take extreme exception however if they were to note down events accurately surely this would just be another form of evidence.
Social services having to record means they cannot deny knowledge of events, or be accused of recording inaccurately as there will be evidence of what was said. It also can act as a form of reference to ensure reports reflect events.

attributes.action: Make energy drinks age restricted
attributes.background: Energy drinks are full of caffeine and other ingredients that can lead to serious health issues. I, along with many other people, feel that all energy drinks should be sold under the age restriction law. I feel that the ingredients in energy drinks are not suitable for children younger than 16 years
attributes.additional_details:
Energy drinks are loaded with sugar and caffeine (sometimes more than twice the caffeine that's in a can of cola) so they’ll certainly give you a temporary energy jolt. However, the boost is short-lived and may be accompanied by other problems.
The caffeine in energy drinks can make you feel irritable and restless. It can increase your blood pressure, while the sugar can contribute to weight gain, especially if you don’t exercise regularly. http://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/tiredness-and-fatigue/Pages/energy-mythbuster.aspx

attributes.action: Increase the amount of funding allocated to our police force
attributes.background: West Yorkshire Police are stretched to capacity, more funding urgently needs to be allocated to enable the force to be more effective, match capacity to demand. Currently demand outweighs capacity, officers are under huge pressure facing assaults and huge workloads. More frontline police are needed.

attributes.action: After The EU, Let The Public Decide Where £350 Million A Week Should Be Spent .
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum held on June 23rd 2016, the public made a democratic decision not to spend £350 million a week on the EU. 

As the public made the democratic decision not to spend it on the EU, the public should now democratically decide what £350 million per week should then be spent on.
attributes.additional_details:
As Agriculture received the largest amount back from the money spent on EU membership, the government must pledge that the higher percentage of the money saved from not being in the EU will be spent on agriculture. 

Every 4 years the public should then have a democratic say on where the remaining percentage should be spent, through official voting on a ballot, with boxes asking if the money should be spent; either: completely on the NHS, on public services, or education. This must be honoured.

attributes.action: Remove international students numbers from the Immigration statistics
attributes.background: Britain is acquiring a poor reputation as a study destination for foreign students which will be exacerbated by Brexit. We need to stabilise this important contributor to universities finances and the wider economy, and immediately address fears about Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013-14 there were almost 67,500 international students attending London universities – making up 18% of the total student population in the capital, and 22% of the 310,000 international students across the UK. They contribute £1.32bn in fees; £1.36bn in subsistence spending, and £121m from their friends and families who visit them in the UK.

attributes.action: To appoint an independent judicial body to review the EU referendum campaign
attributes.background: There have been considerable concerns regarding the statements that were made during the EU referendum campaign & then their subsequent retraction. Our aim is to investigate & hopefully to establish why such things happened during the course of the campaign & to learn the lessons for the future.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose that the House of Commons appoints an independent judicial committee, comprised of senior Commonwealth judges, to review claimed deceptions in the campaigns leading up to the poll of 23 June 2016 on the UK’s membership of the European Union.

Given the advisory nature of the referendum, this would enable a review of the alleged deceptions and their impact on voters, with the findings reported to Parliament- the ultimate arbiter on when article 50 should be implemented.

attributes.action: Give a fine to parents if their children are persistent bullies.
attributes.background: I am asking for this petition to be signed so parents realise if they do not prevent their children from bullying other children persistently they would face a fine.
attributes.additional_details: As an aunty to my niece, who was bullied on many occasions, mainly from the same girl, I'm sure I speak for many parents who have found it devastating to watch someone go through this ordeal. This not only affects them, it actually changes them as a person. So would really be greatful for this to come into effect.

attributes.action: Class babies that have passed from 12 weeks on as stillbirth not miscarriage!
attributes.background: My daughter passed at 16 weeks gestation and i delivered her naturally at 20 weeks. She was perfect in everyway. Toes fingers everything all perfectly formed. She just wasnt alive. Shes down 'officially' as a miscarriage and i think the law on this needs changed!!
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately a lot of babies who have passed before 24 weeks and are 'categorized' as a miscarriage. This itself is a miscarriage of justice. Our children were here, we held them, we talked to them. They may have been born sleeping but they were still born!!

attributes.action: Allow all emergency services to use spit hoods!
attributes.background: Several infectious diseases are contained in saliva, I wish this subject to be discussed in Parliament and come down on the side of all emergency services.

attributes.action: State Pension Payable Immediately On Completion Of 40 Years N.I. Contributions
attributes.background: Recent State Pension changes means many people will contribute around 50 years N.I contributions before they will receive a State Pension, despite the Government themselves saying 35 years is the amount of contributions needed to create it in the first place.     Pay the pension at 40 years maximum.
attributes.additional_details: If your employer say they will pay you £10 per hour for a fifty hour week, then you only receive £350, you'd feel a little more than a little miffed - but that's exactly the "deal" we are being sold by the Government with increased retirement ages.     By their own admission, you need to pay N.I. contributions for 35 years to get a full State Pension.     So why are we expected to work longer?     Any individual completing 40 years contributions should have their pension payable from that point.

attributes.action: Urgently ban the use of preventative antibiotics in animal agriculture.
attributes.background: Antibiotics used in agriculture are a serious the threat to human health. Overuse is driving up levels of antibiotic resistance, leading to new superbugs. There must be a total ban on "preventative antibiotic use" where animals are given the drugs to prevent infection or speed up their growth.
attributes.additional_details:
This ban should also cover imported meat where antibiotics have been used. In many countries throughout the world animals use more antibiotics than humans. 

The use of antibiotics in farming represents a critical threat to public health. If antibiotics stop working, which is a distinct possibility, the outcome could be apocalyptic for humanity. We would go back to the days where a small cut or infection could be fatal.

No new antibiotics have been discovered since 1987.

attributes.action: Penalties against custodians turning away people accompanied by Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: Access discrimination to become a criminal offence with hefty statuatory fines put in place with further offenses increasing the fines given and lead to liquor, transport, or trading license being revoked
attributes.additional_details:
Across the UK, there are currently over 6,700 disabled and impaired people who have become the recipient of Assistance Dogs, specially trained to help them so that their disability is less of the daily burden it was before.
In 2010 the Government abolished the Disability Discrimination Act 1995, replacing it with the Equality Act 2010. This Act is insufficient in making companies fall in line with such procedures. This must be addressed with penalties put in place for non-compliance.

attributes.action: The UK must not leave the European Economic Area (EEA) without a referendum
attributes.background: The UK voted in a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to leave the European Union. No referendum has been held on whether the UK should leave the European Economic Area (EEA). Therefore we, the undersigned, ask HM Government to legislate that the United Kingdom cannot leave the EEA without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises all 28 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Membership of the EU and EEA is separate, as evidenced by Croatia's joining of the EU on 1st July 2013 and its delayed provisional joining of the EEA on 12th April 2014. Most rights enjoyed by citizens of EU countries apply equally to citizens of EEA countries, most notably the free movement of people. If the UK leaves the EU without leaving the EEA, it will be similar to Norway or Iceland.

attributes.action: Allow European residents living in UK to vote if there's another EU referendum
attributes.background: I am a Spanish resident living in London since 2000, working in the NHS and paying my taxes in this country. I believe is very unfair that the EU citizens did not have the opportunity to vote if we want to be out or in from the EU. My request is to give us a voice as we are tax payers supporting UK

attributes.action: Make inquests fair - Widen the legal aid scope for families attending inquests
attributes.background: The current system for providing legal representation for families at inquests is unfair and imbalanced. The current system allows public bodies legal representation, usually at public expense. Families are left without similar access & strict tests in exceptional cases for   obtaining legal aid.

attributes.action: Change the education list to include martial arts in P.E
attributes.background: This years GCSE list does not included martial arts. How can this happen when we are all trying to stop obesity.
attributes.additional_details: Also how do the younger generation feel if they are pursuing a lifetime ambition to represent their country and find they cannot take there chosen martial art as a option in the GSCE P.E format.

attributes.action: Legalise use of medical marijuana for chronic pain (and other conditions)
attributes.background:
Myself (and many others in the UK) struggle daily with chronic pain and other painful problems out of our control.

Why should patients suffer major side effects from pain meds meaning they are unable to function normally in day to day life leading to job insecurity, and reducing their dignity.
attributes.additional_details:
"Almost 10 million Britons suffer pain almost daily resulting in a major impact on their quality of life and more days off work." - https://www.britishpainsociety.org/media-resources/

"Medical Marijuana Seems Safe for Chronic Pain" - http://www.webmd.com/pain-management/news/20151007/medical-marijuana-seems-safe-for-chronic-pain-patients-study-finds

"Cannabis use... better quality of life in patients with chronic pain." - http://www.jpain.org/article/S1526-5900(16)00567-8/abstract

attributes.action: Lower Child Support where no Staying Contact, unless Child Protection issues.
attributes.background: Welfare Benefit Reforms mean the parent getting Child Benefit after separation can access the systems to get up to the income the law says they need.Child Support is not counted for means tested things, but more has to be paid if there is no Staying Contact, encouraging ex partners to try to stop it
attributes.additional_details: In the past 3 months there has been several cases on the Separated Dads Forum, where ex partners are opposing staying contact, just to get more Child Support. Some have even gone to the extent of false reports to Police/Social Services what then stopped contact for months, while investigation is ongoing. Children need both parents, and the no staying contact amount should only be paid in extreme cases due to Child Protection/Welfare. The starting amount should be based on 53-104 nights contact.

attributes.action: Class mysogynistic verbal harassment or physical approach as a hate crime in UK
attributes.background: Whether they are sexual or racial slurs, all verbal harassment and physical approaches are hate motivated. They are done to intimidate and cause upset/distress to the victim. Sexual harassment is still too often regarded as trivial and there is no current law that protects the public against it.
attributes.additional_details: Nottinghamshire police have started to record these instances of mysogynistic abuse as hate crimes, and this should be implimented nationwide. Whilst walking I was verbally harassed by a group of men in a car last night; the exact same thing happened to a friend. In this last week I have been yelled sexual comments at in the street by a man, and objectifyed so much on a busy train that I had to change carriage. Everyone has the right to live without being the target of sexual inappropriateness.

attributes.action: Urge FIFA to overturn the England V Scotland Poppy Ban
attributes.background: FIFA want to stop players wearing Poppies at the game, as apparently it is a political statement?  How is honouring our Armed Forces doing this?  I feel the Government should urge FIFA to overturn this ban.

attributes.action: Stop private companies offering NHS services from using the NHS logo.
attributes.background:
Private companies such as Serco, Circle, Virgin and others deliver NHS services using the NHS name and logo.

The public does not want the NHS privatised and most people have no idea that they are being treated by the private sector.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS logo is a tried and trusted brand. If private companies give poor care while operating under the NHS brand, the NHS is likely to get the blame

It is important that users of healthcare services know who is providing the care they are getting.

attributes.action: Make Southern Rail give automatic refunds to all customers affected by delays.
attributes.background: For months now, those of us who travel on Southern have been blighted by delays due to 'staff sickness' which has since morphed into 'a shortage of train crew'. Annual ticket holders get no compensation and it is not simple for others to claim, so Southern continue to profit on poor performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Southern services continue to be severely affected by train crew availability including a high level of conductor sickness, which is leading to some services being cancelled for part or all of their journey.
Planned industrial action affecting Southern services on Tuesday 21 June
A list of the services which have been pre-cancelled is available here.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/plan-your-journey/live-running-information/incidents/#iAD816EDFC4114A84A299ABF7D41FE43F

attributes.action: Make assisted suicide for terminally ill patients legal
attributes.background:
As a veterinary surgeon I have euthansed many animals and consider it an honour and priviledge to have been able to end their suffering and give them a swift and painless end. 
At aged 47 I was diagnosed with breast cancer, and despite it being caught early 18 months later it is now terminal
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against assisted suicide seems to be that people could be coerced into taking their own lives. Frankly if other countries can put in measures to reduce this possibility, I cannot think it is beyond us. To die, at a time of ones choosing, painlessly and with loved ones around you is surely what we all wish for.
 My situation is far from unique and 1000's of people are condemoned 
to an end of pain and suffering which could so easily be avoided. Is this not what true compassion is?

attributes.action: Children at a school nursery should get a reception class place at that school
attributes.background: not all children attending a school nursery meet criteria to get allocated a place within the reception class. I want to make a change and make it a criteria that if a child attendeds a school nursery they are offered a place within the reception class of that school.
attributes.additional_details: In the first year of attending nursery children become accustomed to the rules and routines of there new school, They get used to there surroundings and make lots of new friends. To then not get a place within the school along with all of there friends could set them back in terms of the confidence social skills and there education.

attributes.action: Include Fathers on Antenatal and Postnatal Mental Health NICE guidelines [CG192
attributes.background: Mark says “I’ve spoken to fathers with bipolar, schizophrenia, clinical depression, anxiety and other mental health illness who have no support plan in place at this crucial time. Fathers Suffer from Anxiety, Postnatal Depression and Trauma at childbirth too. Research says 1 in 10 fathers are (PND)
attributes.additional_details:
Clair Rees 1001 Critical Days Blog http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/clair-rees/fatherhood-a-generational-shift_b_10564612.html
Fathers Institute Perinatal Mental Health : http://www.fatherhoodinstitute.org/2010/fatherhood-institute-research-summary-fathers-and-postnatal-depression/
 Fathers and Childbirth Trauma:http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/why-the-trauma-of-childbirth-on-fathers-is-no-joke-8572222.html

attributes.action: Extend the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to include crustaceans
attributes.background:
Crustaceans are not covered by existing animal welfare legislation. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 states that its protection can be extended to other types of animals if it can be proven that they are capable of experiencing pain.
Scientific evidence proves that crustaceans do feel pain.
attributes.additional_details:
There is much scientific evidence to suggest that crustaceans feel pain.
As crustaceans are not in the animal welfare act, they can be killed in any way. This usually involves boiling them or hacking them to pieces whilst they are still alive. 
Animal welfare organisations are calling for greater protection for these animals, based on sound scientific evidence and the provision in the Act.
Reference: RSPCA, Animal Aid and Shellfish network

attributes.action: Appoint a youth representative to negotiations on exiting the European Union.
attributes.background: Acknowledging the evidence that 75% of young people (18-25) voted to remain in the EU referendum, we call on the government to include a youth representative in the negotiations on Britain's exit from the EU to speak for young people and their future in Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
The polls up to and following the referendum showed young people overwhelmingly in favour of Europe, one of the largest of these shows that 18-25 year olds clearly voted to remain: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/

Recognising that this affects the future of our country and our long term economic stability, we ask that young people get a voice in shaping this future.

attributes.action: That MPs should debate and vote on an inquiry into the events at Orgreve
attributes.background: they has been a lot of distrust between workers and the police due to the suspicion that the events on 18 June 1984 between police and pickets at a British Steel Corporation plant in Orgreave, South Yorkshire.
